articles.author: Pavel Polityuk, Anastasiia Malenko
articles.description: Russia launched another prolonged drone attack on Ukraine, killing one person and damaging swathes of Kyiv as well as striking a maternity ward in the southern port of Odesa, regional officials said early on Tuesday.
articles.title: Russia's latest drone strikes hit Kyiv, maternity ward in Odesa, Ukraine says

articles.author: Kate Holton, Alistair Smout
articles.description: Top U.S. and Chinese officials will resume trade talks for a second day in London on Tuesday, hoping to secure a breakthrough over export controls for goods such as rare earths that have threatened a global supply chain shock and slower economic growth.
articles.title: US-China trade talks to resume for a second day

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Two Chinese aircraft carriers were spotted conducting simultaneous operations in the Pacific for the first time, Japanese Foreign Minister Takeshi Iwaya said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Two Chinese aircraft carriers seen in Pacific for first time, Japan says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Yemen's Houthi-run Al Masirah TV reported on Tuesday that Israeli forces were conducting strikes on the Red Sea port city of Hodeidah.
articles.title: Israel strikes Yemen's port city of Hodeidah, Houthi-run Al Masirah TV reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Police declared all of downtown Los Angeles to be an unlawful assembly area and ordered protesters to go home after a third day of violence hit demonstrations against President Donald Trump's immigration policy.
articles.title: Los Angeles police order immigration protesters in downtown to go home

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping told South Korean President Lee Jae-myung on Tuesday that the two countries should respect each other's core interests and major concerns, and ensure ties move forward "on the right track", Chinese state media reported.
articles.title: China's Xi urges respect, 'right track' in call with South Korean counterpart

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Australia will seek to disprove the "corrosive" idea that democratic institutions are failing amid significant global uncertainty, and play a stabilising role in the region, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Australia has stabilising role amid rising global division, says PM Albanese

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine's overnight drone strikes have forced a temporary suspension of flights in all airports serving Moscow and the country's second-largest city St. Petersburg, but caused no damage, Russian officials reported on Tuesday.
articles.title: Ukraine's drone attacks temporarily halt flights in Moscow, across Russia

articles.author: Alasdair Pal
articles.description: An Australian woman accused of the murder of three elderly relatives of her estranged husband by feeding them poisonous mushrooms disputed on Tuesday accounts of the fatal lunch given by other witnesses, a court heard.
articles.title: Erin Patterson: Australian accused in mushroom murders disputes accounts of fatal lunch

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States should treat Taiwan like a partner and not an adversary, remove new and proposed tariffs, restore high-level cabinet visits and agree a double taxation deal, the American Chamber of Commerce in Taiwan said on Tuesday.
articles.title: US business group says Washington should treat Taiwan like partner not adversary
